intro: Spragueanella curta, commonly known as the short spragueanella, is a small, annual herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as desert scrub and rocky soils. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, green, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are typically pale green to yellowish in color. Spragueanella curta is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with minimal water availability.
